answers.answer: Try having your doctor contact your insurance and explain the situation.  Sometimes the doctor can express how urgent the issue is and that this is the best way to address it for now.  Good luck and God bless!  Love and Strength to you and your son!

I thought there were state subsidized programs that one could get on for addiction.  My best friends daughter was able to get on one (in Wyoming) due to her meth addiction.  She was even eligible for a scholarship due to her recovery work and continued NA/AA sessions.  Can you check it out? Or maybe call the local hospital to find out if they have a program that you can enroll your son in post-clinic and if possible, see if they know if the state can subsidize?

I will check ...  I don't mean to sound like I am complaining..  it is important that he gets well....  but...  it was $500.00 cash up front...  1st visit...  covers him for one month....  first script on Monday, $44.00, 2nd script today $98.00...  I am a teacher, and my income is limited.....  hopefully there is a resource......  he also is going to college....
Deb..what's his plan for getting off Sub? Is he planning a short term taper? This stuff is expensive, but I only had to pay for 2 weeks of pills in order to do a 14 day taper.
i'm not sure...  I guess it is up to the doc????  I do not think that he thinks he can get off of anything short term.....  he's prob thinking a couple of months.....

Well Kudo's for being a teacher - and kudo's for being a good parent and getting your son on his way to recovery.  Sometimes we 'neglect' to tell each 'good job'.As for the $ - you are not complaining.  Aside from those born wealthy, I think we can all agree that we've had to 'tighten' the budget.  That being said, those 'born wealthy' still taste 'desperate' when it comes to addiction - so, although they have the faculties to 'get it', it's not always a plus.Check out the programs in your community - see if the college has a tuition reimbursement program or scholarship program for those 'recovering' and apply when your son has successfully gone through withdrawal.

question: today I took my son back to the suboxone clinic...   they upped his dose ny 4 mg 2 x a day.... which brings him up to 24 mg a day ... 12 2x a day....   suboxone is expensive $98.00 for a weeks supply....  our insurance does not cover the script..... are there any programs that help to defray the costs>>>>??????   IDK why insurance would not cover it, they cover meds for blood pressure, diabetes and PAIN .....  why not this very serious disease known as addiction???
title: suboxone
